summary_points: 1. On August 19, 2025, Carnival Corporation redeemed approximately $322 million of its 5.750% senior unsecured notes due 2027.
2. This redemption was at a price equal to 100% of the principal amount, plus a "make-whole" premium and accrued interest.
3.  The filing states this report does not constitute a formal notice of redemption for the 2027 Unsecured Notes.

1. Medtronic plc announced first-quarter fiscal year 2026 results on August 19, 2025, reporting $8.6 billion in revenue (8.4% increase year-over-year) and $1.26 non-GAAP diluted EPS (2% increase year-over-year).
2.  The company's Board of Directors expanded to 13 members with the appointment of John Groetelaars and William Jellison, effective August 19, 2025,  creating new Growth and Operating committees.

3. Medtronic expects FY26 organic revenue growth of approximately 5% (as of August 19, 2025), and raised its FY26 diluted non-GAAP EPS guidance to $5.60 to $5.66,  up from a prior range of $5.50 to $5.60, primarily due to improved tariff impact assumptions.
1. Home Depot's Q2 2025 sales increased by 4.9% year-over-year to $45.3 billion, despite a slight decrease in net earnings per diluted share.
2.  The company projects a 3% decline in diluted earnings per share and a 2% decline in adjusted diluted earnings per share for fiscal year 2025.
3. U.S. comparable sales (1.4%) outperformed overall comparable sales (1.0%) in Q2 2025.

1. Claude Wade, Executive Vice President, Chief Digital Officer, and Global Head of Business Operations & Claims, will step down from his current responsibilities on December 31, 2025, transitioning to an advisory role due to ongoing health issues.
2.  No significant numerical comparisons are present in this 8-K filing.
3. The filing does not specify future impacts or risks associated with Mr. Wade's departure beyond his transition to an advisory role.
1. On August 18, 2025, Michele G. Buck retired as Chairman of the Board of The Hershey Company, and Huong Maria T. Kraus was appointed as her successor.
2. The SEC filing is an 8-K Current Report, filed on August 18, 2025.
3. No specific future impacts or risks are mentioned in the provided text.

1. J M Smucker Co held its Annual Meeting of Shareholders on August 13, 2025, where shareholders elected nine directors for a one-year term and ratified Ernst & Young LLP as the independent auditor for the fiscal year ending April 30, 2026.
2.  Shareholder approval of executive compensation, as disclosed in the 2025 Proxy Statement, was 73,039,845 votes for and 5,239,631 votes against (advisory vote).
3.  Approximately 89,904,202 shares were represented at the August 13, 2025 meeting, constituting a quorum.

1. On August 15, 2025, Baker Hughes Holdings LLC entered into a $2.6 billion term loan credit agreement to partially finance the acquisition of Chart Industries, Inc., with Baker Hughes Company acting as parent guarantor.
2.  The year-over-year change in Baker Hughes Co's financial statements is not provided in this 8-K filing.

3. The $2.6 billion term loan will mature two years from the funding date (August 15, 2025), and failure to satisfy certain conditions, including the Chart acquisition closing, could lead to termination of the loan commitments.
